Topic.Title: Export options to embed on own site

Posts.EditableText:
Apologies if this has been answered before, but I've had a read through and can't seem to find an answer!

I love the capabilities of this software (I'm on Mac so using the web version), but before I throw myself into creating, I want to make sure I'm able to export the game and run it through my own website. It's not a huge problem if I can't, but I prefer the seamless interaction it provides for my audience. 

I appreciate the help!

Posts.EditableText:
I believe the Quest web player only works on a Windows server running ASP.NET.  Believe me, I've looked into the same question!

The good news is the Pixie is developing Quest 6.0, which should be able to run on anything.  The only catch is there's no GUI yet.  https://github.com/ThePix/QuestJS/wiki
Posts.HTML:
I believe the Quest web player only works on a Windows server running ASP.NET. Believe me, I've looked into the same question!

The good news is the Pixie is developing Quest 6.0, which should be able to run on anything. The only catch is there's no GUI yet. https://github.com/ThePix/QuestJS/wiki

Posts.EditableText: You can still host games here and include them on your own site in an iframe. It doesn't make that much difference from a visitor's point of view; except when the server is overloaded and stops responding (which I haven't seen happen as much lately).
